Hi there.

I'm using the latest version (.24) of ksp and I noticed this very bad bug that's occurring with the space center camera. Let's say I'm in the vehicle assembly building and I want to go to the tracking center or the R&D building. When I click "quit" it takes me back to the space center as it should, except the view is extremely zoomed in in-between the vab and the R&D building. That wouldn't be a bad thing, except that I can't zoom out or even move the camera. Because of the camera zoom, I don't have access to the tracking center or launch pad. Quitting and reloading doesn't fix this. The only way to reset the camera to it's correct position is to quit the game and launch it again. In my book; any glitch that requires the player to quit the game just to fix it is game-breaking.

Any help or suggestions would be great.

ps This is my 1st post so don't hate.

Cause the problem. Quit KSP (if it hasn't crashed). Upload your output log (NOT ksp.log) to dropbox or something.

Windows: KSP_win\KSP_Data\output_log.txt OR KSP_win64\KSP_x64_DATA\output_log.txt (depending on which used)

Mac OSX: Open Console, on the left side of the window there is a menu that says 'files'. Scroll down the list and find the Unity drop down, under Unity there will be Player.log Aka Files>~/Library/Logs>Unity>Player.log

Linux: ~/.config/unity3d/Squad/Kerbal\ Space\ Program/Player.log

I have the same bug. Happens randomly when exiting VAB after many hours of playing.

Ill try to remember to get the log next time.

Hmmmm, yeah me too, I'm assuming all of us are running the not-very-stable 64 bit version? This never happened to me before i switched over to using 64 bit a little while ago..... I'll try and get the log next time too

For me it's related to reverting a flight to the VAB and then exiting to the Space Center from the VAB. If exiting from Flight or the Tracking Station it never occurs. Pretty sure this isn't a mod-related issue, though, as (I think) I've seen it 100% stock as well. Though I'm just as useless as the rest of you as I haven't bothered to keep a copy of the log when it happens.
